title: How to Choose a Proper Indian Meal

steps.headline: Choose something easy like samosas for appetizers.
steps.description: These are deep-fried pastries filled with vegetables. Serve a sauce with the samosas such as mango chutney, lime pickle or yoghurt and mint raita. These can, purchased at local Indian stores. They are a favorite of some in India.

steps.headline: Serve some tropical juice (can be purchased at a local Indian store), such as mango or lychee juice.
steps.description: Wine and beers are enjoyable beverages for accompanying proper Indian menus.

steps.headline: Choose for dinner, the main meal at least two to three main dishes, a side of rice, yogurt, and, sambar, which is a type of lentil soup poured over the rice.
steps.description: Most recipes can be found online or in cookbooks. For the main dishes, go easy and try food like, "paneer", which are fried cheese cubes, cabbage curry, tofu curry, etc. Try vegetables and if possible, provide  Indian breads such as Naan bread.

steps.headline: Select a proper dessert.
steps.description: Many people use American delights, though some still use Indian. If you are going to be using Indian desserts, try, "kheer", a sweet rice porridge or Kulfi, an Indian ice cream. You can purchase other sweets in local Indian stores.

steps.headline: For appetizers, grill some, "tandoori chicken."
steps.description: Cut them into small pieces and serve with fried cheese cubes.

steps.headline: For the dinner, cook a fish curry, chicken curry, tikka massla, chicken korma or butter chicken and one lamb or vegetarian curry.
steps.description: Try a dopiaza, Vindaloo or phal. Provide fried Indian bread ("chapattis"), rice, and yogurt on the side as well.

steps.headline: Desserts are pretty much the same.
steps.description: Try, "Falooda." Take sweet noodles, basil seeds, vanilla ice-cream and rose colored milk and mix them in a cup. The taste is great.

text: Vegetarian Food Choose something easy like samosas for appetizers. These are deep-fried pastries filled with vegetables. Serve a sauce with the samosas such as mango chutney, lime pickle or yoghurt and mint raita. These can, purchased at local Indian stores. They are a favorite of some in India. Serve some tropical juice (can be purchased at a local Indian store), such as mango or lychee juice. Wine and beers are enjoyable beverages for accompanying proper Indian menus. Choose for dinner, the main meal at least two to three main dishes, a side of rice, yogurt, and, sambar, which is a type of lentil soup poured over the rice. Most recipes can be found online or in cookbooks. For the main dishes, go easy and try food like, "paneer", which are fried cheese cubes, cabbage curry, tofu curry, etc. Try vegetables and if possible, provide  Indian breads such as Naan bread. Select a proper dessert. Many people use American delights, though some still use Indian. If you are going to be using Indian desserts, try, "kheer", a sweet rice porridge or Kulfi, an Indian ice cream. You can purchase other sweets in local Indian stores. Non-vegetarian For appetizers, grill some, "tandoori chicken." Cut them into small pieces and serve with fried cheese cubes. For the dinner, cook a fish curry, chicken curry, tikka massla, chicken korma or butter chicken and one lamb or vegetarian curry. Try a dopiaza, Vindaloo or phal. Provide fried Indian bread ("chapattis"), rice, and yogurt on the side as well. Desserts are pretty much the same. Try, "Falooda." Take sweet noodles, basil seeds, vanilla ice-cream and rose colored milk and mix them in a cup. The taste is great. Finished.
